luganda: Ababiri babibira ebigambo : naye abasatu babisattula
translation: Two make plans, but three frustrate them.
lesson: A secret is better kept by two than by three; too many people spoil a plan.

luganda: Abagagga n'abagagga baagalana : ekirevu kiyita ku bisige ne kigenda kyegatta n'enviiri eziri ewala
translation: The rich love each other; the beard passes by the eyelashes and joins the hair further away.
lesson: Like will to like; people of similar status naturally bond.

translation: Peasants are like crickets: they establish themselves where the soil is prepared.
lesson: Opportunities flourish where conditions are favorable.

translation: One who counts kernels begins with one.
lesson: All things must have a beginning.

translation: The living keep up only the burning fire.
lesson: People love one when one is still alive or rich.

translation: Those who have ugly teeth: God gives them their meat.
lesson: Blessings of God are not dependent on good looks.

translation: The children of the poor man: make fat those of the rich one.
lesson: Hard work of the poor benefits the rich.

translation: The children of Kintu never die out.
lesson: Mankind is constantly renewed; the Baganda will always exist.

luganda: Aba n'ebingi ng'abimma : aba n'ebitono ng'abigaba
translation: The person who has many things is mean; he who has few things gives them away.
lesson: Riches harden the heart; poverty softens it.

luganda: Abangi babi kulya : naye ku mirimo balungi
translation: A crowd is bad for eating, but good for work.
lesson: Working together is effective; sharing a meal is better in moderation.

translation: If many congratulate you on your work: your day's cultivation is at its end.
lesson: You have worked long and well when people recognize your efforts.

translation: A whole crowd does not obey; but rain makes them listen.
lesson: It takes a powerful personality to command attention.

luganda: Abangi we basimba olunwe : we kyabikira
translation: If many people touch the boil: it will burst.
lesson: Power of public opinion can force action.

translation: People are grateful as long as they are eating.
lesson: Ingratitude is common; appreciation fades quickly.

translation: Men are like trees: they shed their leaves and grow them again.
lesson: Good and bad days follow each other.

translation: Men are like wild animals: some eat their own kind.
lesson: Said of tyrants, bullies, or despots.

translation: Men are like grass: one stalk is used to tie the rest.
lesson: Outstanding people dominate and guide others.

translation: Farmers who like each other: dig up the lumbugu together.
lesson: Cooperation leads to shared success.

luganda: Abataka tebeesigwa : omuntu enviiri z'azaalibwa nazo, bw'afa nga zivaako, ng'asigaza amannyo agaamera obukulu
translation: Farmers are not trustworthy: man loses the hair he was born with, but keeps the teeth grown later in life.
lesson: Good things of old are soon forgotten.

luganda: Abeggami b'enkuba bagenze? : nkuwe erimonde lyo eddene
translation: Have the people who took shelter from the rain gone? Now let me give you the big potato.
lesson: Said after unwelcome guests have gone.

luganda: Abika atali wuwe : abika ayanjala engalo
translation: One who brings the death-notice of a person who is not his relation: spreads out his hands.
lesson: One personally affected shows grief more sincerely.

translation: The person who covers two anthills at the same time: does not pick up flying ants.
lesson: Splitting your energy causes failure; focus is key.

luganda: Aboogezi abangi : batwala embwa mu katale
translation: A crowd of loud talkers: leads the dog to the (meat) market.
lesson: Too much talking may mislead or excite others unnecessarily.

luganda: Ab'oluganda baagalana : nga bombi bali mu ngoye
translation: Relations love each other as long as both parties are rich.
lesson: Self-interest often governs relationships.

translation: Relations are like beer-calabashes: they bump against each other, but don't break.
lesson: Family ties are strong and resilient.

translation: When relations quarrel: don't put your oar in.
lesson: Don't meddle in other people's disputes.

translation: One who talks, thinks; but one who keeps silent, thinks more.
lesson: Silence allows for deeper reflection.

translation: One who explains things to an intelligent person need not tire himself out talking.
lesson: A word to the wise is enough.

translation: One who moulds a bad pot: adds a bowl to it.
lesson: People try to disguise faults but cannot hide them completely.

translation: One who eats often cold food also gets his fill.
lesson: Perseverance leads to success.

translation: The man who often checks on mushrooms will pick them.
lesson: Consistency brings rewards.

translation: One who possesses makes fun of those who have nothing.
lesson: People often mock others who lack what they have.

translation: One who has many guests: does not quarrel over a burst of laughter.
lesson: Generosity prevents unnecessary conflict.

translation: He who distributes among many: satisfies no one.
lesson: Trying to please everyone leads to dissatisfaction.

translation: What is the news? We throw them into the bananary; those which ooze out we use for drinking.
lesson: Humor or misdirection in answering questions.

translation: If teeth get discoloured: they blame the tobacco.
lesson: People blame external factors for their mistakes.

translation: One who lies in ambush will no doubt kill somebody.
lesson: Evil intentions usually succeed in causing harm.

luganda: Agali awamu : ge galuma ennyama; ow'amalibu akiina wa ngereka
translation: Teeth together chew meat; teeth with gaps sneer.
lesson: Unity brings strength.

translation: One who reminds the orphan of his misery: makes him cry.
lesson: Even kind intentions can cause pain.

translation: A woman who refuses her husband: has no place of refuge.
lesson: Defiance against lawful authority has consequences.

translation: Eyes of those who will eat and those who will not: all look at the cow being slaughtered.
lesson: Everyone expects results, but not all will benefit.

translation: Dances that promise entertainment do not wait for the drum.
lesson: Pleasant things need no command.

translation: Loose teeth are better than no teeth.
lesson: Better little than nothing.

translation: Teeth not standing together do not chew meat.
lesson: Unity is strength.

translation: One who goes home does not consider the night too dark.
lesson: Experience gives confidence.

translation: If a person goes with a good friend: he fares well in foreign lands.
lesson: Good company ensures safety and comfort.

translation: One who travels sees what will happen; he does not tell when he will return.
lesson: Uncertainty is part of life; do not expect exact answers.

translation: He went away without saying good-bye: like a soldier going to war.
lesson: Departure in silence may indicate determination or sorrow.

translation: The person who speaks evil about someone who loves you: makes you report the slander.
lesson: Gossip harms relationships.

luganda: Agoberera : y'asamba; nga si gwe balese
translation: One who follows others hurries to catch up unless purposely left behind.
lesson: People naturally imitate or follow others.

luganda: Agya amangi : ye agamanya kye geddira
translation: He who has many fetishes knows the taboos of each.
lesson: A good leader knows his subjects personally.

translation: Not knowing one's failings makes you blame someone better.
lesson: Lack of self-awareness causes jealousy.

translation: Poverty makes you eat your mother.
lesson: Desperation leads to moral compromise.

translation: What is poured out cannot be gathered again.
lesson: No use crying over spilt milk.

translation: Morning weather is often not the same as evening.
lesson: A bad start does not always mean a bad end.

translation: Great forgetfulness makes you ask from someone you refused before.
lesson: Forgetfulness may prevent success.

translation: A big job needs more than one person to manage it.
lesson: Teamwork is necessary for large tasks.

translation: A guest who arrives late in the evening makes children go to bed hungry.
lesson: Timeliness matters.

translation: Even a beautiful visitor who stays too long becomes insipid.
lesson: Prolonged attention may reduce interest.

luganda: Omulungi tabulako kamogo : embwa tekala nnyindo
translation: Even the beautiful one has a bad point.
lesson: Nobody is perfect.

translation: The sick cannot raise his head without help.
lesson: Support is necessary for the weak.

translation: The sick person has given me trouble while alive.
lesson: People complain only while things are ongoing.

translation: Even when one member of the clan misbehaves, the whole clan is disgraced.
lesson: Individual actions affect the community.

translation: A traitor trusts his legs; when owing a debt, he runs away.
lesson: Dishonesty is revealed through actions.

translation: If an acquaintance does not offer his hands for greeting, he has forgotten you.
lesson: Social cues indicate relationships.

luganda: Omumizi agambwako : nga si mwana wo
translation: The immoderate eater is reprimanded unless it is your child.
lesson: Family may excuse behavior that outsiders cannot.

translation: One who says nothing is like a thief in the household.
lesson: Silence can be suspicious.

translation: One who plants early reaps before the lazy one.
lesson: Early action pays off.

translation: The careless person is not our friend.
lesson: Reliability is the basis of friendship.

translation: An evil heart destroys a person.
lesson: Internal malice leads to downfall.

luganda: Omutwe gwe mugumu : gw'otambuzza mu kifo
translation: A hard head gets injured when used wrongly.
lesson: Stubbornness causes harm.

translation: The head that refuses to obey: will never learn.
lesson: Obstinacy prevents growth.

translation: The head of the land provides for the people.
lesson: Leadership benefits the community.

translation: A person's mind can hold ideas and anger.
lesson: Thoughts and emotions coexist and shape actions.

luganda: Omutwe gwe mugaso : gugumira ku muntu
translation: A valuable head is dependent on the person.
lesson: Wisdom and capability depend on application.

translation: A child of the nation never perishes.
lesson: Heritage and lineage persist.

translation: A beloved child speaks wisely.
lesson: Affection encourages expression of wisdom.

luganda: Omwana ataggwa mu maaso : ategeza ekirungi
translation: A child who falls in front learns what is good.
lesson: Mistakes are the best teachers.

translation: A child not disciplined is taken for correction.
lesson: Discipline is necessary for growth.

luganda: Omwana bwe akola ku mukwano : akola ku ssanyu
translation: A child acting in love spreads joy.
lesson: Kind actions generate happiness.

luganda: Omwana gwe ssanyu : akola ku mukwano
translation: A happy child spreads love.
lesson: Joy and affection are linked.

translation: A sibling child manages food well.
lesson: Responsibility is cultivated in familiar settings.

translation: A rich child does not need to fight.
lesson: Security comes with provision.

translation: A young child speaks wisely.
lesson: Wisdom can appear at any age.

luganda: Omwana gwe mulungi : akola ku mukwano
translation: A good child acts in love.
lesson: Virtuous behavior spreads goodwill.

translation: A child manages his affairs wisely.
lesson: Even young ones can display maturity.

luganda: Omwana gwe mukyala : akola ku ssanyu
translation: A child of the home spreads joy.
lesson: Domestic peace brings happiness.
